summary: The Congressional Budget Office projects that federal deficits will average $1.2 trillion per year through 2029—adding to the existing $16 trillion in public debt. The Treasury Department will need to borrow from investors to finance the government. To ensure low borrowing costs, Treasury must maintain strong demand for Treasury securities (e.g., bonds) from diverse investors, such as foreign and domestic banks, money market funds, and...
title: Federal Debt Management: Treasury Should Strengthen Policies for Market Outreach and Analysis to Maintain Broad-Based Demand for Securities
